message.content:
cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.IR, cs.AI

The paper presents a scalable algorithm for learning statistical models from massive high-dimensional data, which is a common problem in machine learning and data science. The focus is on partial least squares regression (PLS), which is a technique for linear regression that is widely used in various fields. The paper proposes a novel approach called compression-based PLS (cPLS), which uses a grammar-compressed representation of data matrices to reduce working space and improve scalability. This approach is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), databases (cs.DB), information retrieval (cs.IR), and artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
